summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate check sheets from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Special Housing Unit for August 8, 2019. The sheets record staff checks on inmates in continuous locked-down status across several tiers (G, H, J, K, L, M, ZB). The logs are reviewed by lieutenants and a captain, indicating standard prison monitoring procedures.

events.title: Daily Inmate Monitoring
events.description: Routine 30-minute checks conducted on inmates in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York. Staff members are required to observe inmates at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.

keyFacts: The document is a set of prison check sheets dated August 8, 2019, from MCC New York's Special Housing Unit.
It details a mandatory observation protocol requiring staff to check on inmates in locked-down status at least twice per hour.
The sheets cover multiple tiers (G, H, J, K, L, M, ZB) within the Special Housing Unit.
Each sheet is reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain, indicating a chain of oversight.
The document is marked 'CONFIDENTIAL' and is part of the SDNY (Southern District of New York) case file series.
